website_summaries.verdict: A very affordable keyboard that still has some of the features of more expensive gaming keyboards.
pros: Features quiet, easy to type on keys
Choose between more than 10 presets for the three-zone multicolored backlighting
cons: The keys are very sensitive to liquid and stop working after even a very minor spill

customer_reviews.title: Good, but...
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard itself has an excellent feel to it and the software makes it easy to tweak the RGB if that's what you're into. However, the Caps Lock and Num Lock indicators stop working randomly and intermittently. I looked online and this appears to be a common issue across Corsair's entire keyboard line, which is disappointing. It's annoying to say the least when you're typing a password and you're not sure if caps lock is on or off. Unplugging and plugging it back in will fix it temporarily but it will eventually happen again, which is really just unacceptable for such an expensive keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would RGB again
customer_reviews.text: colors are amazing,just wish purple and cyan were a little brighter. easy to set a custom settings and adjust speeds,this keyboard doesn't slip around and i can easily see the keys in the dark, the detachable hand guard is a plus and doesn't impede my use of the keyboard. overall i'd say this keyboard is a very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: anthony pisano

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat this for 50$
customer_reviews.text: For 50 dollars you can't beat this keyboard. The RGB is very nice, you can setup the lights to scroll, to pulse, you can set how fast they scroll, you can set the colors in 3 different areas individually ( left, middle, and right) you can make it all one color, like all Red or all blue... The keys are not mechanical so don't expect the sharp click of a mechanical keyboard but they don't feel cheap either, I like it better this way because a mechanical keyboard is very noisy and I find that anoying. Great value for your money it also comes with a detachable arm rest.
customer_reviews.author: JonyQ

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase if you are a gamer or use Steam
customer_reviews.text: - Major malfunctions with Steam - Causes games to momentarily crash The keyboard by itself and/or the iCUE software will interfere with Steam software. You will experience crashes, extremely long startup time (for the Steam program), and Steam Controller loss of input. You can expect other games to crash as well. I have my keyboard hooked up to a USB hub, so whenever this happens, I just turn off the keyboard and everything resumes normal functioning.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Corsair isn't the same anymore - don't count on warranties
customer_reviews.text: Been using corsair for well over 10 years and over that time I purchased tens of thousands of dollars of corsair equipment. Owned my own computer store and sold hundreds of custom rigs with corsair power supplies, cases, watercoolers, ram, etc. All thats over now since they wouldn't honor a warranty on a H115i with a 5 year warranty when the pump failed 2.5 years in. First they told me to "shake it" (the pump is dead dead), so when that didnt work they refused to replace it. Other reviewers are right that they aren't the same company anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Lorri Udall

customer_reviews.title: Macro do not work well for gaming
customer_reviews.text: the build in Macro do not work well at all. For online gaming where there is a delay to activate each skill when pressing each button, the Macro on the keyboard do not register the button/ skill delay. The build in Macro will spam all the skill so fast that the skill dont register which makes the build in Macro useless. [EDIT] after doing many google research and trying to see what other people have problem with i downloaded the iCUE software for Corsair and i was able to adjust the delay input for the Macro. Now, it is pretty useful. i will give this a 4/5 star from a 3/5.
customer_reviews.author: Yee

customer_reviews.title: Overall A Good Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace my old gaming keyboard that had some software issues with Windows 7. I love the custom-colors setting. Very comfortable to type on. Tad noisy, but since I listen to loud music and movies most of the time, it's not a problem for me. I am very pleased overall with this keyboard. My one problem is that when I've had an unexpected shutdown and the computer reboots with that "start normal or start in safemode" screen, the keyboard doesn't work. I get to wait the full thirty seconds for it to auto-reboot normally instead of being able to kit the enter key. Annoying, but not a huge problem.
customer_reviews.author: Leiko Burningbear

customer_reviews.title: THE IGHTING IS AWESOME.
customer_reviews.text: notice how the l in lighting was missing in the title? multiple keys drop and dont respond randomly. MAINLY the "2" on the 10 key and the "L" on the QWERTY. literally have a cheap keyboard I'm changing to until the corsair k68 mechanical one i ordered in will arrive. jesus this is soooooo frustrating this took me about 10 minutes to type cause i kept realizing the "L" s were missing. FML
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: M
customer_reviews.text: The lights are cool, set up quickly. Never programmed 1 of the programmable keys. I will not buy another. After several months of use, the w, a, and s keys have lost luster and will remain in the depressed state until you pop them up manually. I have had junk keyboards last through years of gaming. I am returning to my last free asus keyboard that came with a tower I bought years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Comand

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE THE SIDE KEYS!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality keyboard. It is a magnificent combination of the mechanical action I love, with a significant reduction in volume. I can now type without hurting the ears of those listening. But Those absurd, horrible G keys on the left make this thing virtually useless. I consistently hit them instead of "Ctrl" or "Esc". Consistently. I've been typing on a keyboard without those keys for decades. Maybe this is OK for gaming, but I need it for office use, and it is quite useless for me. Super disappointing. Wish I had noticed those in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Pritchett

customer_reviews.title: Budget Friendly High Quality!
customer_reviews.text: For a budget friendly membrane keyboard this thing is PACKED with features usually found in more expensive keyboards! Leave it to Corsair to bring in the goods! Dedicated Macro Keys, programmable LED lights, removable wrist support, removable keys for easy cleaning....this thing has so many features! I'm not a huge gamer by any stretch but I like to dabble, I work at home and really needed a comfortable keyboard that has really easy to find home keys, back-lights for working in lower lighting environments and good reaction keys. THIS totally came through! I'm really impressed! It's not a True Mechanical keyboard but boy-howdy does it do the job!
customer_reviews.author: S Baker

customer_reviews.title: A good board for the price
customer_reviews.text: It feels good. I haven't missed a key yet. Quiet, comfortable, accurate. Plenty of color options - though i was really only looking for something backlit. I haven't figured out a way to adjust the brightness. I work with the room lights on or off at different times. Room lights off, the indicator lights such as numlock and caps lock are annoyingly bright white compared to the subdued lighting of rest of the board. The text for finding keys (important on a new board) is miniscule. The wrist rest is thinner than the board and so doesn't actually offer any support when typing. A good board for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Myke

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable to use! ALSO RAINBOWS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Take my money please!!!!(actualy dont though I need it...) I am very pleased with this board it's very comfortable on the wrist with support at the bottom, the keys aren't to loud but they have a smooth tap to them which is pleasing to my ears personally. The colors have a smooth transition over the board. It's over all a nice product even more so with how much you pay for it. One thing I find kinda interesting is that such characters on the board like O,Q,G,D,B,C,Z are all kinda smushed but it isnt anything I'm complaining over it's just a funny thing I noticed.
customer_reviews.author: Howard C. Gay

customer_reviews.title: Easy to customize, great feel, overall 10/10!
customer_reviews.text: Feel: The keys feel firm and sturdy when pressed, exactly what I was looking for in a product that I need to withstand who knows how many presses (gaming and CS grad school). Look: They keyboard looks great with the keys lit from underneath with a customizable backlight. The pictures stand for themselves (currently using a green theme). Customization: The keyboard comes with an app that makes it really simple to customize the color and effect you want. As a bonus, it also includes a dashboard setting that shows key system operations! (See picture). Overall I would definitely recommend this keyboard to anyone! 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Has its cool functions.
customer_reviews.text: Several things I like about this keyboard. 1) Macro buttons on the left end are useful. It's intuitive to use; just hit the "MR" button on the upper right, select the G-number you want that key to memorize, then enter your keystroke combo you want assigned to that G-number. Hit the "MR" button again, and the macro has it remembered. 2) There's some travel to the keys, so you know if you're clicking. 3) Wristpad is a neat add-on. The only dislike I have is that the RGB lighting isn't too bright. But it's easy to customize the 3 zoned colors. Overall, not a bad keyboard for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Benson

customer_reviews.title: How to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good keyboard and comfortable to use. The 1 star I took off was the size of the key printing. The light only lights po underneath the keys not laser etched where the light shines trough the keys. If you game in the dark not good. The lighting has no directions but here is what I found. There are 3 different sections of lighting. If you hit and hold the FN key and press F1 key you can cycle through all the color choices for the left 1/3 of the keyboard. FN + F2 dopes the same for middle of keyboard. FN + F3 does the same for numeric keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Alton D. Flanders

customer_reviews.title: 100% Worth - Satisfying and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good gaming + remote meetings keyboard. I was switching between a clicky mechanical and a soft touch Topre keyboard. Essentially, I replaced 2 keyboards worth $450 for this one. I type 140wpm and thoroughly enjoy the feel of these non mechanical keys. I was surprised by how satisfying it was to type. The software is super janky and weak though. Took a bit of work to get the macros figured out. Then its surprisingly high on the CPU useage, which is a common complaint. 100% worth and will buy another when this one dies.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Null

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The key stroke is good. The back lighting is good. It has six programmable keys, which is useful. It is easy to find the home keys and easy to type on. Bad: The numlock and caplock indicator lights are way to bright, blinding, overpowering every other light on the keyboard. A piece of electrical tape fixed it; of course, the lights are now not visible at all. For the price I paid, I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for Price, Good for Budget PC Builds as Well
customer_reviews.text: Corsair always lives up to the hype for me. All in all, this keyboard is great. Feels good, looks clean, and performs and responds well. I would recommend this to anyone, and anyone who is budget building and gaming PC, I would honestly say spend the extra 10 to 20 dollars on this than some random named company's $20 "RGB mechanical keyboard". This is worth the money. Build quality is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Jared  Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware broken by software
customer_reviews.text: If only this had internal memory so I could disable the corsair software. Being a VR user I simply cannot live with the startup connect disconnect sounds that forces me to double check 6 different USB connections. Without the software this is just a mediocre basic keyboard with very few functions, not worth the price. With internal memory and no running app I would be forced to use this to the end of time due to key feel, lighting, and the performance of the keys while not always getting picked up by my mic. Reminds me, great streaming keyboard, I can get pretty harsh on this before it gets picked up audibly.
customer_reviews.author: Chuckscrazed

customer_reviews.title: eh
customer_reviews.text: My computer, speakers, and mouse have a blue back lighting. I wanted a keyboard to match but this one was weird. The space between the keys are wider than normal to expose more lighting. It made typing a little awkward but it was nice looking. The entire keyboard went out after about 9 months and I had toss it for a better one. No weird spacing. Definitely good just for looks, not really good for any major typing or gaming you would be doing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, just do your research on motherboard compatibility
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard itself is great but something with the software/firmware for the keyboard made it incompatible with my motherboard. I had to order a usb cable switch so that I could have power cut to the keyboard while the computer boots up, then I can turn the keyboard on. If I don't then my computer wouldn't boot on the first attempt and I would have to restart the machine to get it to finish booting up. If it weren't for that work around I'd give it five stars
customer_reviews.author: Firekeeper

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect for heavy typing
customer_reviews.text: Not a gamer. Needed this for everyday software dev and business writing. It's a great keyboard. Very good tactile feel. Love the backlighting. Has more macro features than I need, and they are easy to use. Only drawback is the macro keys. My fingers sometimes mistake that vertical left hand row for ESC, ctl, etc. That's really my fault as a typist, rather than the keyboard, but I wish they had a non-macro version of this same keyboard, without the G keys. Still, overall, great product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stern

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard unless you want G Keys for World of Warcraft : /Fail
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard for the price. But the G Keys don't work in WOW. If you program them and then try to use them will at the same time using WASD, it stops your movement, which of course makes them worthless. Other than that the keyboard is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Strickland

customer_reviews.title: More pretty lights on a decent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: By no means am I a keyboard snob. The RGB isn't individually addressable, and the keys don't sound like you're using a typewriter in a severe state of disrepair, so if that's your thing, move on. I LOVE this keyboard. A good level of resistance on the keys, without that obnoxious clicking you get with all those fancy switches or whatever. Lights have 3 levels and a large amount of variety, as well as being easy to change on the fly. Haven't used the macro keys at all, but I've got them, I guess. I use this for hours every day and haven't lost any functionality yet.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Liked this so much we bought 4 more
customer_reviews.text: We are a family of gamers with home offices. We all had razer black widow Stealths for years. They are high end and the best for gaming. They last forever, but they are noisy and the driver software needs constant updating, I tried this when I wore the letters off my black widow and wanted something quieter. This is quiet and the look and feel was similar to my black widow. I let the rest of my family try it and ended up getting 4 more. no more yelling over the chatter of the keyboards or muting my mic because of my noisy clatter. Very happy family.
customer_reviews.author: allexx

customer_reviews.title: The best keyboard ever.
customer_reviews.text: The keys are a tiny bit loud but I don't really mind it. Everything is great about this keyboard, I love the wave effect Cons: The CTRL key is a bit short so it's kinda awkward for me to press it while holding shift with my pinky Edit: I had this keyboard for many months now and it's failing, The lights don't turn on anymore so I have to plug it back in again to make it work but it will turn off after a while The CAPS LOCK key light doesnt work after a period of time and when you're playing a game like rainbow six and plug in the keyboard the game crashes.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: It was good... until it stopped working. Go with Logitech!
customer_reviews.text: UDAPTED REVIEW. Piece of garbage. One day I plugged it in... Four white LED lights were flashing and it wouldn’t work. Complete waste of money. I hope Amazon or Corsair would at least send me a new product. PREVIOUS REVIEW I love this corsair keyboard! The buttons are perfectly spaced, which prevents me from pressing two at once, as I tend to do with the generic windows keyboards. The lights seemed pretty lame, but they are actually really cool. I can use the keyboard in the dark, and can easily see the keys. My only complaint is that the G1-G6 keys will input 1-6 not sure if this a a programmable feature. But overall the keyboard is great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nope. Nooooope. Nope.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is extremely over priced. Cheap plastic, garbage LEDs, and mushy keys. If you want cheap, buy a keyboard from a B manufacturer. I have several e elements that are a tremendous value. Buy something like that and then you won't have to pay the corsair tax.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: The "cushion" is 100% plastic, no give whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard itself is nice, quality build. However I had custom keys and they dont fit this keybord even though they fit my last, i was kind of disappointed. The reason I took this keyboard is the palm rest, i bought this keyboard mainly because of the palm rest and numpad, because the palm rest looked like a decent cushion but in reality it is just a hunk of plastic, no give whatsoever, and the look of the design suggests it is a cushion... Not a fan of that.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for work, not gaming.
customer_reviews.text: This is very helpful for my work. The macro feature saves me retyping the same stuff over and over. I only wish the macros were much longer than 50 keystrokes. I managed make the macro call a batch file that loads a much larger text into the clipboard. That's been a real lifesaver. Also like that the keyboard is driverless and will retain the macro settings if unplugged or moved to another computer.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Gud Get
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my setup, easy to set up macros and rgb without any bloatware needed, just simple key combos. Key actuation feels almost exactly the same as the stock dell kb212b i was using before, just with more travel and a little more solid. The extra width because of the macro keys takes a little getting used to, my muscle memory kept putting me a key over for the first few hours. I would reccomend it to anyone who wants a quality high end looking keyboard for a good price and isnt yet spoiled by mechanical boards.
customer_reviews.author: Austin VanDrisse

customer_reviews.title: Sending it back
customer_reviews.text: As a keyboard its fine. Feels responsive. My problem with it is the back lighting is apparently not working. I've plugged it into Xbox One as well as my laptop and have tried to get the LEDs on. On laptop the software seems to sense color changes and such and shows a pic of how the keyboard is supposed to look, but it's dark. Moving on to something else that has RGB that is a bit more programmable and works.
customer_reviews.author: Phantom79

customer_reviews.title: It was exactly what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a keyboard that I was somewhat familiar with and this one is what I wanted. I have one of the other Corsair keyboards that has red LEDs inside of it and is laid out identically to each other. I finally found out how to get custom colors on it and I am very satisfied with it. It does exactly what I wanted it to do and I have no issues with it. If I had to buy another one of these keyboards, I definitely would do so.
customer_reviews.author: paul robinson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and responsive
customer_reviews.text: This is a great membrane keyboard. I've been using it at work (software engineer) for about a month now, and it's been exactly what I wanted. The G-keys down the left side took a little getting used to (I was accidentally typing '6's instead of hitting Ctrl for about a week), but now that I'm accustomed to it, I very much enjoy the quality feel. The key backlights will leave something to be desired if you're looking for the light show associated with more spendy Corsairs (or some similarly priced other brands) as these backlights aren't as customizable, but I didn't get it for the basement "wow" factor, so for the price, this suits me fine.
customer_reviews.author: Nice Hat Harry

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price, fragile.
customer_reviews.text: Pro's Full Size, Light weight but enough heft to not move around, satisfying key click and high responsiveness. Key travel is ideal. Con's -Longevity, I have had this keyboard for 2 months and have already lost control of some of the special functions related to lighting and locking keys. Can regain it shortly if unplugging and plugging back in but definitely going downhill. If anyone has had similar issues let me know if there is a fix. -Colors, do not love the color options, I usually just keep a white background but it would be nice if there was a way to more subtly fade into other colors.
customer_reviews.author: Archibald Rowan

customer_reviews.title: Feels good and has useful extra buttons
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard feels good and is fast. I am not a gamer but I type a lot. The keyboard has high-contrast labeling and has a no-nonsense layout. The extra gaming buttons can be programmed to do things that would otherwise hurt your hands. I use them for cut, copy paste, etc. The iQue software is a bit much and was interfering with some other stuff in my system. I found that, if you read the manual, you can do all of the essential features (macro key programming, adjusting color and brightness) can be accomplished from the keyboard. The iQue software is not essential.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Gross

customer_reviews.title: So far so great
customer_reviews.text: I have many keyboards. I play a lot of games! I also so some streaming. I am pretty happy with the keyboard. It's plug and play right off the bat! So it was SUPER easy to setup. Of course, if you want to set up the Marcos you will need the software but u can get it very easy on the corsair website. It is very easy to setup. I had it for over 2 weeks and no problems. Works amazing. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dangioffre

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this thing in today. Looks and feels great! I was looking for a high-end membrane keyboard. I previously used mechanical but had gone through 4 different keyboards in 7 years due to defects such as keyboard chatter. I need something reliable for school with a little gaming on the side. This keyboard is perfect for that! It's typically Corsair quality. Very well built and ergonomic. Also, $50 is a great price point for a keyboard like this. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Steel

customer_reviews.title: Lovely keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I love the variety of colors and settings! I have mine set in a combo of pastel yellow, pastel purple, and bright blue. It is aesthetically pleasing. The keyboard feels amazing when I type. It isn't too loud either and I love the size of it. I had a small mechanical keyboard in the past, but this certainly is an amazing upgrade, I don't use it for gaming so I'm not sure about its performance in that. I use it for writing papers and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Keyboard -- but the Left Column of 'G' keys detracts.
customer_reviews.text: It's a VERY well made keyboard. I'm not a fan of mechanical keyboards -- too noisy. I grew up with them, I get it -- it's just not necessary imho. This non-mechanical is VERY well made and a GREAT choice. The one thing keeping it from 5 Stars -- In my haste, I didn't notice the row of 'G' keys on the left. You will get used to them in time, but it's natural to orient one's hands based on the corner of the keyboard. For this reason, I often found myself hitting G6 instead of control, which was annoying. I'd rather these be at the top of the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: AntiochInteractive

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard but definitely NOT dust resistant
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for 6 months and so far I like it. It's a membrane keyboard with mechanical qualities, but it's pretty quiet which is exactly why I got it. I took away a star because the dust resistance is virtually nonexistent. This keyboard collects dust at the same rate as most of my other equipment. Not a game changer but important to note. Overall I'm quite happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LoLo Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great,  only while it lasts.
customer_reviews.text: Quick & short. RGB zoning is a cool touch, a function gaming/media keyboard BUT, the shift button is already wore out/broke it only registers 1 out of 5 times i press it, this was aglfter literally less than 2 months of use, light use. Also keys are a bit soft for my liking, which makes it feel very cheap. Other then that all the bells & whistles are cool, when they work. Not a very reliable keyboard, i wouldnt use it in a competitive match or anything, maybe an MMORPG for fun.
customer_reviews.author: Honest reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great feature-rich product that will not disappoint your pocket book.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a quick-replacement budget friendly RGB keyboard under $50 for light to moderate gaming, this is the keyboard for you. Although the keys utilize membrane switches, the typing experience and response is not bad at all. Surprisingly, Corsair provides 6 macro keys on this keyboard that can be easily programmed with the onboard macro recording button (no additional software required). This keyboard is designed to plug in and go. The RGB patterns are limited to three zones but can be adjusted to your personal preference by holding the FN key and keys 1 through =. Great Job Corsair!
customer_reviews.author: SANTI S.

customer_reviews.title: Very good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this keyboard. I enjoy how quiet it is and the lighting is adjustable and elegant. The lighting can be controlled per button toggles as listed on the manual or through the iCue software from the Corsair website. I'm not a fan of the macros button layout. I keep hitting the macros button when I try to press the esc key. It also doesn't have the problem I tend to find with some keyboards, where if you type fast enough, they can't keep up.
customer_reviews.author: Overlord Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Quality Keys
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t pick this for the lights, but they are awesome. Use for gaming and day-to-day tasks, love it for both. The keys don’t make too much noise and feel good to press (not too hard or too easy to depress). I would have preferred a version without the extra keys on the left side, as I don’t use them in my gaming and accidentally press them instead of the keys I need.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Solid build keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard for all use especially gamers This keyboard has some really great features and performs excellent. It comes with a detachable wrist support. When I first plugged it in and driver got loaded for basic use, downloaded the manufacturers driver and was able to use and customize the features. Back lighting is always nice. I used the software to change factory setting of multi color to a solid color and lessen the brightness. The tactile feel of the keys is good as you would expect.Nice and quiet to use. There are six programmable macro keys. There are also pre-configured sound keys such as volume up and down, mute, etc.. Keyboard is especially nice to use in low light conditions
customer_reviews.author: Matthew McCabe

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard, attractive features, gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to beat for the price. NOT a mechanical keyboard, but has a good feel to it, its quiet, and looks great. The programmable keys on the left are great for some games that require multiple button pushes. If I could go back though, I would get a higher tier one that allowed me to program individual button colors instead of just the three zones.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. It won't connect every other boot.
customer_reviews.text: I happened to get this keyboard during a time where I was using the BIOS a lot and most of the time it won't connect. I couldn't get into the BIOS because the keyboard didn't connect, good thing ASUS put a button on the motherboard for direct access to the BIOS. I had to unplug the keyboard a lot and plug it back in because it wouldn't sync or it wouldn't connect. It only has 3 lighting zones. I decided to splurge and I bought the ASUS ROG Flare, it is expensive, but worth it, I absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: No 5 star?
customer_reviews.text: First things first, why no 5 star? Its because theres a small issue on my keyboard. Im not sure if anyone else deals with this but the caps lock light wont turn on. So i never know if im on caps lock or not unless i type. I shared a video so you can see we returning else is working. With that aside this is an amazing keyboard. This is one of the coolest keyboards ive ever used for its price. Tho no usb ports on the sides or headphone jacks. Also i advice not to buy a warranty from amazon, it comes with a defects warranty out of the box. 9/10
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this during the Black Friday special and couldn't be happier. I'm used to typing on laptops so it's a bit of an adjustment but that's not the products fault. Pros - Responsive keys - Isn't silent but it's definitely not loud - Large (can be seen as a con I guess) - Colors are pretty - Media keys (top right of keyboard) - Six (6) macro keys (left side of keyboard) - Removeable wrist-rest - Two adjustable heights (raised, flat) Cons - Wish there were more keys (screen brightness, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Klimasewski

customer_reviews.title: Nice backlit keyboard with 6 macro keys
customer_reviews.text: I am not a gamer. I tried another backlit KB from Amazon at half the price, but it really stunk. Keys kept wanting to pop off and the backlighting on the keytop was very dim when not viewed from directly over the KB (not the way if use a KB). The keys feel nice and solid and "clicky." The backlighting is very good and the keytop characters are very easy to read when viewed from a normal position. I really like the 6 macro keys on the left side of the KB and the volume controls on the upper righthand side of the KB. All in all, a very nice KB worth the 50-odd bucks I spent.
customer_reviews.author: Ancient One

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely phenomenal.
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review with the keyboard, and may I say, it is absolutely great. For one, it is a gorgeous piece of equipment that goes well with any build, no matter what color your build is centered around. My PC build is very red, and I switched from using a red backlit keyboard to this one, and there has been no impact to the theme of my build at all. The rainbow looks great and the keyboard is even quieter than advertised. Haven't had a chance to test out the MACRO keys yet, but I can't imagine they will remove any functionality. absolutely fantastic keyboard, 10/10 would recommend to anyone in the market for an affordable gaming keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: mom of three

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for the price! I came from a gaming mechanical keyboard that was rather loud and needed something quieter for my late night study sessions. This provided. It not only looks beautiful, but the keys feel great and the additional keys at the top are awesome when watching videos. If you are like me, a college student on a budget who needs something for school with the occasional game, then by all means this is worth it. Can't believe it is only $50.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: After using laptop keyboards for years, it takes some getting used to to get back to this kind of keyboard but once you do it's so nice. I like it a lot. I was able to program the backlight color to all yellow, which is pretty cool. I didn't get it for gaming because I am more of a console gamer, but I am a video editor and gaming keyboards are good for that as well with the programmable keys. It's built nice too.
customer_reviews.author: ChelceeTop Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Not good for normal typist. Good for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: After having this a while I had to order another keyboard. The keys are very small and weird shaped, its very hard to type on. There is little room for the keys due to the extra buttons on the left. If all you want to do is have fancy lights and use WASD, this is fine. Might be great in an MMO where you just use voice chat. But if you need to also actually type something fast and allot like a chatroom, buy a full size keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: ethiric

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Typing on this keyboard is a joy. It has a nice sound, the right amount of resistance/feedback, and it's not loud. The colors look great. I'm not a fan of the multi-color schemes, but it allows you to cycle through several solid colors, so that's what I do. My favorite feature is the programmable macro keys. As a SQL developer, I find myself typing the same few keywords and statements over and over again. I've programmed the macro keys to type out common SQL clauses that I use. It'll even capture carriage returns when you record your keystrokes. I think this is the best keyboard you can get for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Decent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It's a good keyboard. I don't really use the colors or anything since I use it as more of a typist instead of gaming. It's comfortable to type on and I don't make many mistakes. The only things I will say is that it wasn't really apparent to my that this was a regular membrane keyboard which is fine since I'm not super picky. I was expecting a mechanical keyboard though. Aside from that, the actuation force is a bit high. I have a Cherry MX Brown keyboard to compare to. And this keyboard definitely takes a much higher force to press the keys.
customer_reviews.author: Bilal H.

customer_reviews.title: So I ended connected them to an Anker USB hub and they my computer boots like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why my laptop detects it and my corsair harpoon mouse as bootable devices, so won't let me boot up. So I ended connected them to an Anker USB hub and they my computer boots like a charm. Tried to change boot settings on BIOS, no success. Contacted DELL and Microsoft and they did not help. It's something about UEFI Secure Boot. But I don't manage to turn it off. Overall, the item is really good. The custom colors keys lights, the default color schemes, they keys feel, the look of the keyboard. Best kb I've purchased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Hdz

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the money
customer_reviews.text: It has nice feel and function. The colors can be solid one color across the keyboard, but limited to about 8 colors. Only complaint is that the caps lock and num lock indicators are at the top and it can be a little difficult to tell which is which by just looking at the lights in the dark, bit a key press can confirm what's what. I wish the media keys lit up, which is the only real negative I would give the keyboard. If I had known that probably would have spent twice as much for the mechanical version, which might light il the media keys. Not sure, sine I don't own the higher models. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: EureskoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Red Dragon K552
customer_reviews.text: Had this keyboard for a month now and I love it. I had the Red Dragon k552, but i missed the numbers pad and the mechanical noise was too loud. The K55 from Corsair is awesome. The noise is next to nothing and I still get the same response time so no big loss. I am much happier with this one now. To change the keyboard colors though you will have to watch the tutorial or read the manual because it was not easy to remember for me
customer_reviews.author: kalyn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent solid RGB membrane keyboard at this price point
customer_reviews.text: For $50, this is a great keyboard. It IS membrane, not mechanical (thus the price). But it is one of the best membrane keyboards I've ever had. It is plastic but doesn't make the cheap plastic noise that most plastic keyboards have. It is very solid and doesn't rattle. I have one qualm in the description. Corsair states "Detachable Soft Rubber Wrist Rest". Hmm. I don't believe its rubber and is NOT soft. But it has a bit of texture to it and works fine for me. RGB is only programmable by different zones. But considering all the features you get at this price point, its a deal!
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Fn-F4!!!!! Wooooooo-Hoooooo!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this thing for months now. I really like it. It proforms at precisely its' price point. Oh... get friendly with the key combo Fn-F4. This "reboots" the keyboard when the lights inevitability stop working and you have to deal with dreadfull hold times and tech support, only to be told to hold this combo for 10 seconds untill the whole board flashes white a few time. (Jesus guys, couldn't you just print that somewhere)?
customer_reviews.author: Mikapants

customer_reviews.title: The "e" key stopped working 4 months in.
customer_reviews.text: Can't find any warranty info, and I'm out a keyboard. Shame. It was nice to type on. But I kind of need the e key, you know?
customer_reviews.author: Ray Cornwall

customer_reviews.title: Average Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard comes in branded from Corsair. Expected more from the keyboard but the manufacturer's software iCue is not able to configure the keyboard. Ports wise, this model comes in at one port, saving you an extra USB port if many devices are the way to go. Also, the shortcut keys on the left feel out of place. One tends to pressing the 'G1'shortcut key instead of 'Ésc' when the latter needs to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Ng

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price point
customer_reviews.text: Decided to return, typing on it felt too 'mushy'. Lights and RGB are good (I just prefer default white), 3 adjustable brightness settings are available. As for a budget option this is an okay pick, no drivers are annoying software (Synapse 3..) needed. If it was mechanical at this price it would be solid, Corsair should have a budget mechanical RGB (cheapest is roughly $90!).
customer_reviews.author: Quigenator

customer_reviews.title: Didn't make it past 6 months use
customer_reviews.text: I loved this keyboard for awhile but after 6 months the shift key on the left side stopped working unless you smashed it really hard. Keyboard gets an immense amount of use but I this isn't acceptable. I removed key to try and see if I could clean it out or otherwise resolve the issue but it did nor. It's unfortunate because I really liked this keyboard but due to it's lack of durability Inwould not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JeffFL

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic keyboard, especially considering the price. It's really wonderful to type on and game with. The lighting is pretty cool and you can turn it off if its not your thing. The wrist support is really comfy as well. I have not installed the control software or used the macro buttons but I can see where they would be useful, especially if you are into MOBAs or MMOs. I recommend this to anyone looking for a quality keyboard that doesn't want to shell out for a mechanical model.
customer_reviews.author: davis

customer_reviews.title: I thought Corsair was better than this.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite gaming mice have been Corsair, I use their memory in my gaming PC's, so when I needed a new keyboard I went with this. I've had it for a month, and have to buy a new keyboard. It takes a minute to even respond when the PC boots, so my SSD drive's boot speed is irrelevant. While using it, the keys will randomly stop working, freezing me in place during game play. Last night it just stopped working at all, I had to reboot the computer. Don't waste your money or time.
customer_reviews.author: Mole

customer_reviews.title: Won't Stay Connected to iCUE
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great budget gaming keyboard. However, if you're buying it just for the RGB you might want to upgrade. It never stays connected to iCUE software, so no matter what pattern or color you set it to, after a restart or even after the computer goes to sleep the keyboard loses connection with iCUE and reverts back to the default color wave. I've changed USB ports, made sure everything is up-to-date, etc. It will stay connected for a short while, then losses connection and is back to default.
customer_reviews.author: Mojozer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The item shipped in appropriate packaging. Item arrived undamaged. I have been using this keyboard for a few months now and really enjoy it. It's very comfortable and the RGB lighting is a nice perk. After using the keyboard for a few months, I'm happy with the purchase. If you're looking to pick up a new keyboard, I would highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like a dream
customer_reviews.text: This was for my son. He is VERY hard on keyboards. From typing reports to playing games to enduring fits of rage, he expects them to take abuse, and have just a perfect feel at the same time. He asked me to avoid a mechanical keyboard to avoid the noise. I asked him what he thought, and his brief review was "It's like a dream". That's all the review we will ever get from him, but that translates into a "Highly Recommended".
customer_reviews.author: Charlie D

customer_reviews.title: Great priced light up keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great priced light up keyboard. I don't use the macro buttons myself but I love the dedicated media keys. For whatever reason it's hard to find a nice keyboard with those buttons that isn't flimsy or way over priced. The wrist rest is nice as well. It's basically a perfect replacement for my old keyboard, except now it glows! I've had this keyboard for a while now and I haven't noticed any fading of the key lettering. Only weird thing I've noticed is that sometimes even when my computer is completely shutdown, the lights on the keyboard stay on. Not really an issue since my computer isn't in my bedroom, just an observation.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is awesome! Whole surface under keys is glowing, not just keys themselves. There are only three zones of backlight, you can't customize every single key. But these three zones are customizable (with some presets). Need to get used to additional keys on the left: first time a often pressed G1 instead of Esc. Macros can be recorded without installing any software. Keys are made of matte plastic. Palm rest is some kind of "rubberized" or soft touch (sorry for my English).
customer_reviews.author: jbot

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for non-gamers too
customer_reviews.text: Love the feel. Nice and quiet. Love the simple backlight options. Macro keys kick butt and save me from having to create Auto Hotkey scripts. Love how there's no keyboard software to learn. Wish it had some USB ports. (One of the bullet points said it had two USB 2.0 ports but the K55 model I received doesn't have any.) Also wish the print on the navigation keys was larger (Insert, Home, Page Up, Page Down, Delete, End, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Call (☼ ONE Interpreting)

customer_reviews.title: Not mechanical, but better IMO
customer_reviews.text: Not quite a mechanical keyboard, however it's like a hybrid between mechanical and rubber dome. Kind of like softer brown switches. The fact that you get multimedia keys and 6 macros built in is incredible. And you don't even need software to program the macros. This keyboard is by far worth every bit of $50. First Corsair keyboard and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace a Logitech wireless that was having some sort of communication issue (no, wasn't batteries :) This is a nice, solid-feeling keyboard with attractive and customizable colors. It has a great, comfortable feel, quiet (but not silent) keystrokes, and is wide enough to fit the keypad comfortably. I would get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Spish

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic inexpensive RGB loud keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: The RGB colors and patterns are great. The keys are great. Macros are great. Tactile feel while typing is great. Similar to a true mechanical keyboard, though not one. Layout is good, spacing is good. Holds up well so far under massive amounts of typing daily. The wrist guard fits and actually works well. I'd buy this again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: I'm a grandma, not a gamer, but from what I'm told, it's a great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson received two gaming keyboards (one Christmas list shared with several relatives). After trying them both out, he decided he wanted the one I purchased. He ended up keeping the other as a spare because my son informed him that they wear out rather quickly, but they were both more impressed with the Corsair K55 RGB Gaming Keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Susanne R.

customer_reviews.title: overall great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard works great and does everything I need. ICue can be a bit frustrating and sometimes it doesn't want to play nice with elgato and shadow play but other wise it works great. Had to stop using a mechanical keyboard because it was TOO loud. The G-keys and media control buttons have come in very useful for streaming and pausing/playing music while in a game. After a frustrating game I did hit the keyboard and mess up the spacebar. After taking the spacebar off completely and putting it back on, the spacebar went back to working as normal.
customer_reviews.author: David Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Good Keyboard, Quiet and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Great Keyboard. Can change the backlight to whatever color you want. The only gripe was, after a while of searching, I realized the individual keys could not be backlit to use with Keyboard Lighting Software like Aurora. That's my main complaint and if your gonna spend this much on a keyboard, you might as well get one that backlits all the keys separately. But for a general good keyboard that has cool multicolored lights, this is a good choice. Also when I plug this into my keyboard usb port in my motherboard, it doesn't allow me to adjust the volume. If you notice this, try plugging it into a different usb slot.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra

customer_reviews.title: So far I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this keyboard. It'll take some getting used to because I'm used to the flatness of a laptop keyboard. Everything works fine and it is a lot quieter than say a mechanical keyboard. There is some weight to it. The chord is a lot longer than I was expecting but that's a good thing. The colours are nice and vibrant, I have it set on the breathing mode same as my mouse. Changing the modes is actually fairly easy. Overall I love it so far. Will look great once I'm done building my rig.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S.

customer_reviews.title: This is the best investment I've made in a long time
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this keyboard almost 4 months ago, and what can I say? It still works. I use my computer everyday! and this is still working. This is the best investment I've made in a long time. The cool part about this keyboard is that the buttons are steady and gives you that typewriter click to it(donno how to explain it), which is a plus! and it glows like a rainbow, i mean like it FLOWS like a rainbow color Edited on 09/03/18 It is still running strong, i have no encountered an issue as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard for Gaming
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is quite nice for gaming and the programmable macro keys are a great feature. However, the product came slightly damaged. The box itself was in good condition, but the space bar was smashed in and the underside of the keyboard was cracked. Fortunately, the space bar was easily fixable and I never look at the underside of the keyboard anyways so it doesn't bother me. Also, the key brightness is supposed to have three different levels, but I have push the button twice to change the brightness, so it's like one of the levels doesn't work. Still a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Needs some work, I can't personally recommend it for what it's intended for.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has an okay physical layout and good media keys. It falls flat though with system use when it somehow needs 4+ device ids which causes a lot of programs to have issues identifying parts or causes hangs and timeouts or directx crashes. The software is kinda janky as well reporting incorrect info a lot. The caps lock indicators and such also happen to freeze alot with status detection. For something supposedly designed with gaming in mind, it falls flat in multiple places. It really needs some drivers or firmware updates. Till then I'd look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard, Right Price
customer_reviews.text: The responsiveness of the keys, the media keys, the macro recorder and the led are all great. I replaced a logitech keyboard with this that was 30$ more expensive and assuming this lasts at least 2 years, corsair will be where I get my keyboards. Each keystroke is buttery smooth and still provides that clacking response I crave out of my mechanicals.
customer_reviews.author: Maxx

customer_reviews.title: Personal Favorite After Using 10+ 100$+ keyboards
customer_reviews.text: I personally have tried many different keyboards from 150$+ logitech keyboards and by far my favorite for typing and gaming is this, i know its not mechanical but the actuation is much better than blue red white speed switches, resembles the brown switches but less actuation pressure and slightly lower. The software is a breeze (turn on advanced if you have created macros) Lighting is nice, Having G-Keys in this price range is insane. All in all perfect purchase. 3 days into owning i dropped a bottle of soda on it and washed it with water and it still works perfectly, not sticky at all, very impressed
customer_reviews.author: LittleFur

customer_reviews.title: Excellent self-contained RGBoard
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I needed. I'm using this with a work machine on which I cannot install any software, so having all of the lighting effects be native to the keyboard is exactly what I was after. Keys have a good texture to them. Typing is a little mushy but it's a membrane keyboard so that's to be expected. Spacing is done well. As others have mentioned there's a spotlight at the top right corner indicating.. something.. helping planes land maybe? But cover that with some electrical tape and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: emonk

customer_reviews.title: It's fantastic, honestly.
customer_reviews.text: Holy shit I love this thing. I had a Corsair K65 for almost two years and as much as I loved the key presses, I've always hated how loud mechanical keyboards are. I know a lot of people love the klacking sound that comes from their keyboard but I've never been a fan. This keyboard feels really solid and the key presses are the best I've felt on a non mechanical keyboard to date. Not to mention it's super quiet. I'll probably get another one when this one stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard was nice and all but i kept having issues with it
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard was nice and all but i kept having issues with it. When i first plugged it in and typed something, the keyboard would type extra random letters. The CUE was excellent in changing the color of the keyboard, but when i shut my computer down the light would change back to the rainbow wave effect and refuse to shut off so it was hard to sleep at night. When i turned my computer on, it stayed with the rainbow wave effect until i opened up the CUE again. I love Corsair products, but this keyboard just wasn't for me.
customer_reviews.author: Potatoes

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard!  Works well, no issues
customer_reviews.text: this is a full size mechanical gaming keyboard. I bought it for work for it's full size and mechanical keys. I find I make less errors on these type than soft touch shallow keys. I can't report on how it is for gaming, but I it works well and I love the color options. It was plug and play for audio buttons, but I hadn't used the macros because I haven't had the need. Corsair seems like a sturdy brand as I ended up getting a mouse of theirs as well.
customer_reviews.author: Trina G

customer_reviews.title: Nicer than the K95 in some ways
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife who doesn't care about mechanical keys. I also own the K95 and this keyboard feels just as good. If you're on the fence about upgrading to mechanical, this membrane option is perfectly fine. The lights actually look cleaner and nicer than my K95, because there's no open space around the keys. Being able to light individual keys is cool in the K95, but I find that to be more of a novelty. One solid color is fine really. Be sure you are ok with the font style, they are different than the K95.
customer_reviews.author: ThatMouse

customer_reviews.title: So quiet, but misleading RGB.
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet as most membrane keyboards are, but the RGB lighting is a pretty big disappointment as it has 3 separate lighting panels rather than each key having its own light. So, from the left side: G-keys to the V-key, from the B-key to the right Ctrl-key, then everything right of that. I'm not a fan of mechanical keyboards because of the noise and how expensive it is to get them as quiet as a membrane keyboard is stock. But I wish they were a little more clear about how the thing is lit.
customer_reviews.author: ZeroKami86

customer_reviews.title: Ok, this thing is great
customer_reviews.text: I love my mechanical keyboards but when everyone yelled at me for the waterfall of clacking, I looked and found this keyboard. I like it. The feel of the keys is pretty good and the layout is proper. The macros work well, too! I use them to help automate greetings in emails and while not "HotKeys" perfect, the macros are reliable. Then the lights. They're cool and everyone is jelly of it.
customer_reviews.author: CA Cycleworks

customer_reviews.title: Not amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: For 55$ you would expect more. avoid this keyboard and buy a better one. no mechanical keys. only feature is the rgb lighting.... you can literally get all these features for 20$ except for the RGB...
customer_reviews.author: Scott Winterringer

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I only game about 10 hours a month but do use on my home/small biz desktop. I am not gonna be the guy to give you gamer ratings... I just don't have that level of experience. But.... I do like the old school feel and functionality of the KB, for daily use, over the cheap units you get now days.
customer_reviews.author: MertziePlays

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful keyboard, a little lacking in ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: This is a membrane key board so I knew what to expect. The keyboard itself is beautiful. However the ergonomics could be a bit better. The wrist rest is not big enough to compensate for the height of the keyboard. It’s the height of a mechanical keyboard. Long typing sessions will leave your hands cramping. However, playing games no longer than 2-3 hours has yet to cause any issues. It’s a great keyboard for the price. However, I wish I had paid $15 more and gotten the K68 at the time or paid a little less and gotten a compact wireless keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best cheap gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this keyboard. Reviews don't lie. The touch is perfect. The light is fun. I use it for typing and intense gaming. All good. I don't really use the extra keys G1 to G6.. too far away. It's a good idea tho but I don't need it. Combine it with a +3 buttons mouse and you are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: PJL

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I searched a long time for the perfect keyboard and I think I found it. I loved the raised keys and they are super smooth and easy to type. The background lights are fun and can be easily programmed. I could go on and on, but this is A+! I ordered other keyboards and didn't bother trying them out and will be sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: Lia Rose Risheill

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an affordable keyboard to pair with my gaming laptop (so I didn't have to sit hunched over the laptop keyboard), and I was concerned about finding one that FELT right. This one feels like a nice cross between mechanical and membrane, so it sounds nice and feels nice. PLUS, it's gorgeous. I love the different colors you can choose. It feels great and looks great, all for a great price~
customer_reviews.author: Brittany QB

product_meta.title: Corsair K55 RGB Gaming Keyboard – IP42 Dust and Water Resistance – 6 Programmable Macro Keys – Dedicated Media Keys - Detachable Palm Rest Included
product_meta.description: The K55 RGB keyboard is your first step towards enhanced performance. Stay one step ahead with 6 dedicated on the fly programmable macro keys. Multi key anti-ghosting ensures your simultaneous key press combos are executed the way you wanted. The dedicated volume and media playback buttons enable control of all of your media without interrupting the game. Rgb backlighting and intuitive lighting modes provide expressive lighting options, all under your control. Quiet, responsive keys provide a satisfying feel. The K55 RGB gaming keyboard comes with a detachable soft rubber wrist rest to ensure additional comfort during marathon gaming sessions. Keyboard cable type non-braided.
feature_bullets: Dynamic RGB backlighting across three zones, with full customization of colors and lighting effects
Dust and spill resistant design rated up to IP42 protection guards against accidents so your gameplay never has to stop
Six programmable macro keys give you the in-game advantage of powerful macros or key remaps
Detachable, soft rubber palm rest reduces stress on your wrists so you can play longer in comfort
Dedicated volume and media controls give you direct control over your audio without having to interrupt your game
Powerful corsair iCUE software enables vivid dynamic RGB lighting control, sophisticated macro programming and full-system lighting synchronization across all iCUE-compatible Corsair devices
Quiet and responsive keys for comfortable typing during both work and play
Anti-ghosting with selective key rollover means your inputs register in-game even with simultaneous key presses
Windows key lock mode ensures you’ll never accidentally interrupt your game at critical moments

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,191 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
